name: Immersed in Engineering
description: It's time to start getting into the fundementals of electricity and more importantly how to move that electricty around. At it's core this manual will walk you through everything you need to know about setting you your own power generation and what to use it for.

quests.name: Hammer it out
quests.description: Before you can really get started down this path, you need to understand your toolset, and for setting up engineering projects with this manual, you're going to need the right hammer.

tasks.longDescription: The hammer has a lot of interesting properties that we will get into as we explore more about this element of the world, but for now it's the tool you use to interact with everything that comes from the Engineering Manual.

quests.name: More Ore
quests.description: You may have noticed some odd ores in this world. Not just Iron, Gold, Redstone, Diamond, and coal. One of them we discussed earlier, Copper, but there's a few more!

tasks.longDescription: Aluminum, which comes from Bauxite ore has somet limited uses, but the most obvious is in a High Voltage setting. You won't see much of that early on, but it's good to keep around. You can also make it into a few decorative blocks!
Silver on it's own is actually pretty useless but it can be combined with some other things to make this wonderful substance called Electrum which is great for any number of things!
Nickel and Lead both have some limited uses. Nickel can be thrown in an arc furnace to make a pretty interesting little generator and Lead is useful in low and middle voltage capacitors.

quests.name: Grit your teeth
quests.description: So we mentioned that hammer you made has some interesting properties correct? Well one of those properties just happens to be turning a piece of ore into grit or even two grit.

tasks.longDescription: Let's start off with the metals you know a lot about. Copper, Iron, and gold. Simply take your hammer and smash some up and before you know it you'll have your very own gritty solution! Simply put your hammer in the crafting grid with the appropriate ore and you'll get some!
Next we'll take a look at all those new ores you just made. Rather then taking your pick to them, simply take your hammer and see what you get!
Finally we can get a bit of mixed grits. Even if Steve from accounting who  puts salt on his is a savage and wrong. These simply come from mixing two other grits

quests.name: I sell Coke Ovens
quests.description: Before we can get started on our path to making a more complete electrical empire, we must first begin with the basics. In this case the Coke Oven.

tasks.longDescription: Made from sandstone, Clay, and bricks you're going to need to make about 27 of them to complete the 3x3 Structure. Once you have completed it simply right click with your hammer a.nd it will make it into a fully functional coke oven!

Once you have your coke oven the process is fairly simple. Simply place a piece of coal into the coke oven and it will do the rest, making two byproduct. Coal Coke and also some kind of oil... squishy oil.

quests.name: Quest # 420
quests.description: Ok so Hemp and Cannabis technically have slightly different THC Values depending on breed. But for today's time we're going to be working on the more fiber related product.

tasks.description: Do not in fact Blaze it
tasks.longDescription: The book mentions punching grass, this actually doesn't work. You're going to need to use a hoe to till soil to find the seeds. So head out there and get yourself a few and get to planting!
Once your pot plant has all grown up, simply punch it, don't smoke it, and then you've got yourself some lovely industrial hemp fibers which are good for a lot of things.

quests.name: Steeling the show
quests.description: Alright so now you have your coke oven, but you need one more thing to make your empires foundations strong. That of course is a blast furnance.

tasks.longDescription: At the same size as a coke oven, and constructed from netherbrick, blaze powder, and normal bricks. 27 Blast Bricks constructed in the same 3x3 Layout and tapped with the hammer should be all you need in order to complete your structure. Here you can use that coal coke for something useful
Iron + Coal Coke + Blast Furnace = Steel? Capiche? Well it's like one GIANT furnace that makes steel which will be useful for all sorts of things later on.

quests.name: Byproduct
quests.description: You may have noticed that in addition to Coal Coke, your coke oven is making something else in there. This byproduct, called Creosote oil has any number of uses that will be wonderful. But perhaps the most useful is with wood.

tasks.longDescription: Creasote oil will gather in the Oven naturally without any real work on your part, to extract it all you need to do is simply put a bottle or bucket into the slot on the oven and presto you have your very own creosote oil. Nice hmm?

Now  that you have the oil, you can use that with some wood planks in order to make treated wood (much like staining a deck) It may seem weird at the moment but we promise it will make more sense later

quests.name: Trick or Treat?
quests.description: Treated wood is an interesting substance, but it does have it's own little decorative properties and that's got to be nice right? I Mean look at it, who doesn't love stained wood?

tasks.longDescription: You will find that like any wood product, Treated wood can be made into the various wood Friendly shapes. Well let's start with something simple
Much like normal wood it can also be made into sticks, but it is important to note that these sticks are ALSO treated. Something to keep in mind so you can make things like fences.

Finally there is something with treated wood that you might even go so far as to consider completely new. So give a shot at this lovely post. It's a great thing for placing power lines on later and other things of course.

quests.name: A barrel of fun
quests.description: Sometimes you need to store more then just items, or the way you are storing items just isn't good enough. That is where the Barrel and Crate really help

tasks.longDescription: Created from treated woods, Barrels work much like you might expect a Chest to work, except for a liquid.
The best thing about crates is if they have things in them and you happen to break it... and then put the crate back down they will still have that stuff in them. Good for keeping things on you!

quests.name: Clothy!
quests.description: So now that you are a drug kingpin putting out enough weed, we mean Hemp, per day and you'd like something to do with it. So we wanted to give you at at least a few ideas that might get you started down the path to whatever it is you're trying to accomplish.

tasks.longDescription: We don't really know how or why, but apparently by mixing clay and industrial hemp fibers together you can make your very own hempcrete. It's not got many uses, but it does look pretty

Maybe you've always wanted to rope that one part off but all the other ropes look to tight well Hemp Rope like it's coil counterparts can give a little slack the longer the distance is. Unfortanatley it doesn't carry power, that would set it on fire.

Finally an item that might have some use... in another quest. On it's own it's not great for building all that much but you'd be amazed at how durable and strong this material is. Great for catching wind you might even say

quests.name: Construction Materials
quests.description: Before we get started, we need to understand what Steel can be used for. Once you're comfertable with that we can start sending 30,000 volts through it.

tasks.longDescription: Crafted much like Iron Bars with 6 pieces of steel, these fences will find a great many uses as parts of bigger machines. They also happen to be decorative if you're into that sort of thing.

Scaffolding is the key to almost any real and long term project, and this stuff is great at it. Looking like a carpenters block but having a very different purpose. Scaffolding is used in a lot of huge projects as a way to shape the overall construction.

quests.name: Sheet Metal music
quests.description: So have you ever thought to yourself "Gee I love this Ingot, but could it be flatter?" Well if so then we have an answer for you

tasks.longDescription: Sheet metal has a lot of hidden uses. Metal Barrels, pipes for moving about fluid, and eventually we'll teach you how to make a massive water tower like structure with it.

quests.name: Just a Better Barrel
quests.description: That jabba seemed uncalled for. Those barrels are great, but you know the one thing they don't hold? Hot fluids and who wants a barrel that can hold lava? You do

tasks.longDescription: The metal barrel is actually a fairly simple thing to make all things considered, and much like the barrel it has it's own uses. Keep one around for storing lava safely without worry of those little fire demons spawning

quests.name: Power Overwhelming
quests.description: This is it, this is the start of your path to a more powerful life. The kinetic Dynamo using those oh so strange magnetic properties of Copper is going to start giving you the life you deserve.

tasks.longDescription: The kinetic Dynamo is simple enough, You place it down next to a device that is designe to generate power in some way and move and it will do the rest of the work.

quests.name: More Water Required
quests.description: Chest can only hold so many items, and really sometimes you need EVEN MORE then that. For that ware are just going to have to construct a tank of some kind. Note this can hold a Massive amount of any item and you can scale it to your size needs

tasks.longDescription: Be sure to consult with your engineering manual for exating details on the build. But the basics is a 3x3x7 structure with the base being the 4 fence post on the outside, a single sheet metal block in the center, then 5 layers of sheet metal with a hollow center and finally a cap of sheet meteal. Click it with your hammer to make it fit your needs

It's not just good for items, if you make it about 2 layers shorter, it will now be for liquids. Great if you're looking to store several buckets of water. Again once you've constructed it hit it with your hammer.

quests.name: Wind, Water, and not heart
quests.description: The two most basic forms of natural energy that man could think of were wind and water. To harness the power of either of these were critical to our development of a species and they will be critical to your development of cool and intersting stuff

tasks.longDescription: Wind, you can see it moving things around you but can you see it? Well if the particles are turned up high enough you should. For Wind power the higher up the fan blades are the more power they will generate. Stick them on a kinetic Dynamo and make sure they have some space and soon enough you'll be making wind energy!

Water is the power the carved the grand canyon back here on earth and now you're going to be using it to power your fortress of solitude. So Get to work pouring some water over this wheel (running) and watch it go. You can have up to three water wheels next to each other so keep that in mind!

quests.name: Windmill Take 2
quests.description: So the Windmill you built isn't catching as much wind as you'd like right? You put it up there and it just seems to be missing... something. Well then it's time for you to try out the Windmill everyone loves with cloth!

tasks.description: In the arms of a windmill
tasks.longDescription: You remember that tough fabric we mentioned earlier. Well it turns out if you stretch 4 of them over a windmill blade in a crafting table, you can make an even better windmill blade, but  you might need a few

Once you've got your 8 windmill blades it's simply a matter of putting them down and letting your creation spin to your delight, and spin it willl. Like other windmills the higher in the air it is (Higher Y Value) The more energy it will generate.

quests.name: The Power of the Earth
quests.description: There is one final form of rather passive power generation that might be worth investing in, though as a warning it can only be made from some fairly interesting materials.

tasks.longDescription: This generator is powered by a difference in heat between two objects. Problematically there's only a few objects which REALLY are different enough in heat to cause the change. Lava and Ice, or even... packed ice and normal ice.
Perhaps you should take a look at that Freezer you made with the meteors that fell from the sky. I bet they would be fantastic ways to help keep things in line.

quests.name: Winding Up
quests.description: Alright so you know how to make power, but what about moving the power you make around. The next few chapters will not only be on the uses of that power you made but also how to move it from point A to Point B.

tasks.longDescription: To start off with, most everything you play with will probably be low voltage in nature. For this something as simple as copper wiring should be able to move it around.
There are some things which make more power then your poor little low voltage devices can handle, and for that we have invented the Transformer. To take one power type and convert it to another.

Breakers are items that shut down the transmission of power (or turn it back on). For the demonstration we've asked you to make two. One that you can shut off manually and one that comes on with a Restone Signal.

quests.name: A Measured Response
quests.description: This item is handy in figuring out exactly how much power you happen to be transmitting across a line. It can be helpful in setting up and troubleshooting your electrical networks.

tasks.longDescription: Requiring a Compass, some Copper, and some treated sticks, this particular device isn't too difficult to make and more then that it can net you some help in figuring out all the kinks of on your line.

quests.name: Zap
quests.description: Sometimes Wind and Water just aren't enough to keep things going, so you turn to a solution only Dr. Frankenstein would have thought up. Let your place get struck by Lightning!

tasks.longDescription: It's not trouble at all to make the base. Simply make 9 of these blocks and put them in a 3x3 configuration. Then simply smash it with your hammer and wa la you have your very own Lightning catching base... just one catch, You need something to actually catch the lightning.
At the center of this lightning rod you will find a little hole. Shove sove fences up there and build on up. At the top be sure to make a "net" of sorts by connecting fences off the top most point

quests.name: Industrial Expansion
quests.description: On their own, what we are about to show you really won't have that great an impact on your life. Individually and on their own they are pretty useless, but when you want to start making structures they are absolutley crucial to the completion.

tasks.longDescription: Light Engineering blocks find a lot of use in the simple things. From automated crafting devices to bottling machines. They tend to be in the simpler projects.
Heavy Engineering blocks find themselves in far different uses. Tending to be found in the construction of very complex devices.
These Final blocks are the components that you will find in more specialized devices like Arc Furnaces and power generation like diseal generators.

quests.name: Probe Launched
quests.description: Prospecting the land is a tired and ancient tradition, but we've invented a device that makes it possible without the need for digging all the way to the center of Minecraftia.

tasks.longDescription: Placing the device down, giving it a little bit of power, and then watch it go to work slowly penetrating into the soil and telling you exactly what's inside. This tool is only useful for the Excavator and telling you what that will get

quests.name: Table the discussion
quests.description: What kind of engineer would you be if you didn't have your very own table? These little tables are great for the tiny engineering projects that don't quite fit the scope and scale of worldshaping and for your engineering tools it's a good way to upgrade them.

tasks.longDescription: The table, like Thaumcraft's research table, will end up taking two blocks. It's a great way to work on Guns, Chemical Throwers, and Mining drills if you're into that sort of thing.
Sometimes you've got a length of wire and you don't want to have to break an entire series of structures to clean it all up. Well the wire cutters are your go to tool for just cleaning up the wire.

Only found in villages, the blueprints here are critical to setting up the next phase of research. Drop by your local village and see if one of them doesn't have what you're looking for, you may have to trade or search a while.

quests.name: Piping out the answers
quests.description: You can move items around with hoppers, and if you've looked into it even conveyor belts, but what about fluids? Well this is where we start to show you the tricks and tips.

tasks.longDescription: Fluid pipes are just what they say, you put a fluid in at one end and it will spit it out the other. On their own they don't need any real power, they just sort of do their job.

tasks.description: We're going to pump you up
tasks.longDescription: A pump has a power connection on the top, it can be used to make water move faster, or to pump things up from containters or simply water sources.

quests.name: Helping to Convey the Truth
quests.description: Hoppers are cool for moving items, but sometimes you need something a little more effecient then that. That is where the conveyor belt comes in.

tasks.longDescription: Having the same sort of properties as train tracks in terms of where you can lay them. Conveyor belts will move items across them in the direction that they are going. They're useful for all sorts of things and even more important in the overall development of bigger machines.
There are times you want your conveyor belt to drop off an item, to simply let it fall through the cracks. That is what this little thing is great for. Fantastic to setup with an item router .

quests.name: Boom Headshot
quests.description: A gun is a powerful tool, and it requires a great deal of craftsmanship to make a good one. This is minecraft however and making a gun is a little simpler.

tasks.longDescription: Each piece to the gun has it's own little recipie and guide to follow, so it's something that you'll need to complete in order to put all the parts together.
And there you have it, your very first gun. It's not got any ammunition though does it?
Remember those blueprints from earlier? Well they should help you find method for making all sorts of fun explosive rounds to keep those creepers away.

quests.name: Get to the point
quests.description: Guns are nice and all, but what's really nice about guns is that you can give them all sorts of upgrades to make them even more useful when you are out in the world.

tasks.longDescription: A classic item on the gun is the bayonet, for when ultimately and almost inevitably you end up in melee range with your opponent. Trust us it happens every time and it's no better each time it occurs.
Nothing is worse about reloading then how long it takes. Well this little addon can make that process just a hint faster.

quests.name: Drill baby Drill
quests.description: Sometimes a Pickaxe simply isn't a cool enough way to dig through the earth. For that we're going to need something even more... diggy.

tasks.longDescription: The drill is a tool much like the gun. It can be upgraded with various addons that make it more or less useful underground in theart of turning the underground into a thriving ecosystem that bends to your will.

The drill does require something though, it runs off power and not the kind where you can just string an extension cord to it. Instead you need to refill your drill with a fuel like you would a lawnmower or a chainsaw.

quests.name: Liquid Fuel
quests.description: You've been working with Wind, Water, even geothermal, but if you want some real power you're going to need to burn something, and what's better to burn then a little bit of gas.

tasks.longDescription: These blocks are key to making the industrial sized Squeezers and fermenters you will need. Consult your engineering manual for exacting details, but you should find that you can turn your plants and seeds into a wonderful supply of fuel.
Once you have your perfect lab setup you will be ready to turn your crops into the perfect source of renewable burnable energy .

quests.name: Light Em Up!
quests.description: What's the point of having electricity if you can't even make your own electrical devices? Well that's what we're here to demonstrate, using the power you are making in order to keep yourself safer in the dark

tasks.longDescription: For a basic torch, it gives off a light level of 14, which means for every block from the torch you step away the light level goes down by one. Glowstone gives off a light level of 15, and this little baby does too. But for the surrounding 32 Blocks? Monsters can't spawn in those thanks to this little creation!

A Floodlight requires a bit more power, but it puts off a huge amount of light in a single conal direction. This makes it idea for lighting up distances far away from your base without making the place look terrible with torches.

quests.name: End of a Story Arc
quests.description: This quest will help you make perhaps one of the more powerful machines that immersing yourself in engineering can reveal to you. The all to powerful Arc Reactor .

tasks.longDescription: To get started with what is ultimatley going to be one of the fastest furnaces you have ever seen, we are first going to need something to keep the whole setup stable. Graphite Electrodes are just one of the components this device needs

To complete construction of this, you will likely wish to consult your Engineers manual, as this is a bit of a complex build. The Arc Furnace melts down and creates metals faster then anything you have seen before.

quests.name: Turn on the Oven
quests.description: One of the great advantages of electricity is you don't always need that coal to heat up the furnace or that lava to heat up the cauldrun. No instead this device takes all that and does it for you, becoming a heat source

tasks.longDescription: Place it under Thaumcraft's Cauldron or next to furnaces, it doesn't matter to this little device it will do it's job. Great for heating up things when you need it.

quests.name: Sorting out your differences
quests.description: Everyone hates it when you have items that don't get organized in just the right way? Well now this is your answer to that problem. A device that is entirely devoted to sorting out items.

quests.name: Up Up and away
quests.description: If you're feeling somehwat limited by the ground yo live upon, perhaps you need to look towards the sky! Introducing the Balloon, using that wonderful Tough fabric you made.

tasks.longDescription: Balloons are uinque in that you don't actually need an anchor block to place them. If you just want to put one above your head you can do just that. So expiriment and play around with them and remember that you can use them to string up wire or rope, which might just come in handy for what we're about to show you.

Remember how we mentioned you could string up rope between the balloons? Well this will let you ride on that rope or cable. Simply right clicking with the skyhook will let you ride your way to victory.
